div.p: REPEAL (O.F. rapel, modern rappel, from rapeler, rappeler, revoke, re and appeler, appeal), the abrogation, revocation or annulling of a law (see Abrogation and Statute). The word is particularly used in English history of the movement led by Daniel Oâ€™Connell (q.v.) for the repeal of the act of Union between Great Britain and Ireland in 1830 and 1841-46, which in its later development became known as the Nationalist or Home Rule movement (see Ireland, History).
